const obj1 = { a: 1, b: null, c: undefined, d: 4, e: '', f: {} };
const obj2 = { x: 0, y: false, z: 'Hello', w: [] };
const obj3 = { name: 'John', age: null, address: { city: 'New York' }, phone: '' };
console.log(filterObject(obj3)); // Output: { name: 'John', address: { city: 'New York' } }
const obj4 = { a: 0, b: '', c: false, d: {}, e: 'Valid' };

code: fn main() { // Defines the main running function
println!("Hello, World!"); // Prints Hello, World! to the terminal.
snippets.author: James-Beans

snippets.title: Capitalize String
snippets.description: Makes the first letter of a string uppercase.
snippets.author: Mathys-Gasnier

snippets.title: Read File Lines
snippets.description: Reads all lines from a file and returns them as a vector of strings.
code: let lines = read_lines("path/to/file.txt").expect("Failed to read lines from file")
snippets.author: Mathys-Gasnier

snippets.description: Finds all files of the specified extension within a given directory.
